ReportSection.name: Report Completion Status
ReportSection.tooltip: Evaluation of your report against the reporting rules
ReportSection.Instructions:
This page provides an overview of the degree to which your On-Line Report is complete.

Completion is determined by two factors:

  1. Number of Fields Complete: A field is considered complete if it is not blank. In some cases, like the Milestone Comments Section, selecting 'No' will consider the comment for that milestone unessesary to fill out. Selecting Yes requires a comment though to be considered complete.
  2. Average % of characters used: Any textarea which has a recommended limit to the number of characters used, is used in this calculation. This is the percent of those characters used. Generally speaking, the higher the percentage the better, however it is up to the discretion of the Supervisor and Project Leader.

Note: All your Supervisors have access to your on-line project-specific dashboard rows; your project-specific comments under criteria A B C; and your project-specific milestone comments.

ReportSection.name: HQP Dashboard
ReportSection.tooltip: Overview of this year's activity and productivity
ReportSection.Instructions:
The Dashboard is designed to provide an overview of an HQP's activity in GRAND. The data reported in the dashboard has already been input to the Forum through the various functionalities of the "Toolbox".

  1. The header indicates the name, level, department, university and supervisor(s) of the HQP, along with the GRAND project(s) involved.
  2. The table has a column for publications, artifacts, activities and awards.
  3. The "Publications" column reports the number of your publications, by category. You should "edit each publication" in order to ensure that its data and status are correct. Please note, the dashboard will only show publications entered in 2011 (i.e., it will not include those publications that were included in last year's reporting.
  4. Similarly, the "Artifacts", "Activities" and "Awards" columns report the number of your artifacts, etc., by category.
ReportSection.ReportItem:
If there is an error in any of the information reported in the dashboard, please edit the corresponding element through the appropriate tool. If the error is in a system-controlled field, please contact support.

ReportSection.name: HQP Report
ReportSection.Instructions:
*NOTE: Clicking on the bold blue headings will cause the page to expand (contract) to show (hide) text boxes in which you can provide your information.

The Report section consists of three text boxes: Research; Networking; and Knowledge Transfer. Note that each the text boxes is "split" into a number of text boxes corresponding to the projects with which you are involved. Your project-specific entries will be made available to your corresponding project supervisor(s) to assist with the completion of a similar portion of his/her(their) report(s).

The various project-specific sections are meant to be concatenated into a single coherent text to be read as a whole, so feel free to devote unequal space to the individual project text boxes and to make sure that the overall text reads well and communicates the information you want to communicate about your activity. You can see the overall text corresponding to each of the three report headings by clicking the "Preview" link right next to each heading.

A.  Research (up to 900 characters over all projects)
Briefly summarize your research activity in relation to GRAND projects. For those with multiple projects, the field will be subdivided by project.

B.  Networking (up to 600 characters over all projects)
Briefly describe your activities networking with other GRAND researchers and projects, and researchers outside of GRAND. For those with multiple projects, the field will be subdivided by project.

C.  Knowledge Transfer (up to 600 characters over all projects)
Briefly describe your interactions (if any) with receptors, companies, Project Champions and others in which research challenges and outcomes were discussed or presented. For those with multiple projects, the field will be subdivided by project.

ReportSection.name: Submit
ReportSection.tooltip: PDF generation and submission to the Supervisor
ReportSection.Instructions:
To submit your report, please follow the following three steps.

1. Generate a new report for submission

2. Download the report submitted for reviewing

3. Submit the report
You can submit your report for evaluation. Make sure you review it before submitting. Please note:

  • If you need to make a correction to your report that is already submitted, you can generate and submit again
  • The most recently submitted pdf is used for evaluation
  • If no pdf has been submitted, then the most recently generated pdf will be used for evaluation instead.
  • If you encounter any issues, please contact support@forum.grand-nce.ca

4. Download the PDF which will be used for evaluation
To verify that the correct PDF will be used for evaluation, you can download the submitted PDF

Note: All your Supervisors have access to your on-line project-specific dashboard rows; your project-specific comments under criteria A B C; and your project-specific milestone comments.
